examples: I couldn't help notice how pretty and intelligent she was and we just clicked.
Other intelligent animals experience grief in similar ways.
Are they intelligent?
What would intelligent life look like?
You're very intelligent.
words.defineEn: having or showing a high level of intelligence; good at learning things, understanding ideas, and thinking clearly
words.defineVi: có hoặc thể hiện mức độ thông minh cao; giỏi học hỏi mọi thứ, hiểu ý tưởng và suy nghĩ rõ ràng

examples: Today, your intelligent mind learned about the history of how we think about and define different types of intelligence, what the G-factor is, and how Sherlock Holmes is incredibly intelligent but emotionally unintelligent.
words.defineEn: lacking the ability to understand, reason, or make good decisions
words.defineVi: thiếu khả năng hiểu, lý luận hoặc đưa ra quyết định tốt

examples: A teaspoon of grape vinegar brightened up the tomato soup, giving it a pleasant tang.
Good evening, I hope you had a pleasant day.
We hope you have a pleasant shopping experience.
We work hard to create a pleasant environment for patients, visitors and staff.
I just hope she’s pleasant to him on his birthday.
words.defineEn: bringing enjoyment and happiness
words.defineVi: mang lại niềm vui và hạnh phúc

examples: She found the idea of eating tongue quite unpleasant and decided to stick to her usual choices.
Despite their popularity, she found the smell of chitterlings quite unpleasant and preferred other dishes.
Needs must when the devil drives, so against my will I accepted the unpleasant job to pay the bills.
Even though the millionaire had a reputation for being difficult and unpleasant, he always had people around him, eager to curry favor and enjoy the benefits of his wealth.
A swollen uvula is unpleasant.
words.defineEn: not liked or enjoyed
words.defineVi: không thích hoặc thích

examples: Careful planning laid the foundations for the nation’s economic miracle.
Be careful with your actions.
Be extra careful with this one.
Do be careful, for goodness' sake.
If you cannot be good, be careful.
words.defineEn: giving attention or thought to what we are doing to avoid doing something wrong, hurting ourselves, or damaging something
words.defineVi: chú ý hoặc suy nghĩ về những gì chúng ta đang làm để tránh làm sai, làm tổn thương bản thân hoặc làm hỏng thứ gì đó

examples: It only takes one careless driver to cause an accident.
You'd think he'd be wise as an owl after so many years in this industry, but he's still a careless old fool.
"During wartime, careless talk costs lives, as revealing sensitive information can put soldiers and civilians at risk," said the military commander during the briefing.
'A careless girl!' said Mr. Brocklehurst quietly, almost to himself.
And contrary to negative stereotypes, speakers of AAE are not careless with language.
words.defineEn: not paying enough attention to what we are doing
words.defineVi: không chú ý đầy đủ đến những gì chúng ta đang làm

examples: She has a weakness for polite men, use that to your advantage.
The waiter, with a polite smile, asked if we needed anything else during our meal.
When I visited my girlfriend's parents I tried to be very polite and put my best foot forward.
The situation was so serious that after a few polite exchanges they quickly got down to brass tacks.
The real estate agent was always polite to his clients, but he also knew how to use his charm to close a deal.
words.defineEn: showing a type of behavior that is considerate of other people
words.defineVi: thể hiện một loại hành vi quan tâm đến người khác

examples: As a general rule, it is considered impolite to ask someone about their salary or age, as the proverb goes, 'never reveal a man's wage and woman's age'.
Anything else is very impolite.
I don't like impolite students.
See, you are impolite, and you don't respect others.
Why is that impolitic or impolite?
words.defineEn: having bad manners or behavior
words.defineVi: có cách cư xử hoặc hành vi xấu

examples: She's very friendly and very down to earth.
They had a friendly soccer match with their friends in the park.
He lived in a small town with friendly neighbors.
My roommate and I engaged in a friendly debate about the different ways to prepare mooli.
She approached him with a friendly smile, but she got the cold shoulder, as he turned away without a word.
words.defineEn: kind and nice toward other people
words.defineVi: tử tế và tốt đẹp đối với người khác

examples: The other dogs were unfriendly, too.
He looked very unfriendly. '
And a lot of turtles are pretty unfriendly.
And as unfriendly a place as it seems, lots of life has evolved to survive here.
The environmentally unfriendly disposal of unsold and returned inventory has made big news.
words.defineEn: not kind or nice toward other people
words.defineVi: không tử tế hoặc tốt đẹp đối với người khác

examples: The day followed the usual pattern.
In other words, it's business as usual.
They had to listen to the usual yada yada about bike safety.
Once I contact my usual sources at the tabloids, I should be able to dig up the dirt on that actress.
As usual, the conversation turned back to her children.
words.defineEn: happening or done most of the time
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc thực hiện hầu hết thời gian

examples: When Sarah's friends teased her about her unusual tastes in music and art, she reminded them that every Jack has his Jill, and she would eventually find someone who appreciated her interests.
The person may have unusual mannerisms.
Lamborghini situation is not unusual.
Kathy's situation is not unusual.
Was that unusual?
words.defineEn: not commonly happening or done
words.defineVi: không thường xảy ra hoặc thực hiện

examples: You’ll be lucky!
Thanks, I'm so lucky to have you.
We were lucky to witness a herd of elephants grazing peacefully in the savannah.
Touch wood, I've been lucky enough to avoid any other serious injuries.
It's lucky I was sent here, to Hepzibah, or I'd be pushing up daisies.
words.defineEn: having or bringing good luck
words.defineVi: có hoặc mang lại may mắn

examples: Woe is you, unlucky one.
Lucky at cards, unlucky in love, they say.
We all felt (that) we were unlucky to lose.
Either way, the dinosaurs were pretty unlucky!
Millennials have been unusually unlucky.
words.defineEn: having or bringing bad luck
words.defineVi: có hoặc mang lại xui xẻo

examples: The construction project was completed without a hitch, thanks to the hard work of our team and the diligence of our contractors.
Thanksgiving is never complete without the aroma of a succulent turkey.
Tacos aren't complete without a generous amount of grated cheese on top.
They made complete pigs of themselves at the dinner.
Please return the completed form at your earliest convenience.
words.defineEn: having all the necessary parts
words.defineVi: có tất cả các bộ phận cần thiết

examples: Your list is incomplete.
You have an incomplete cupboard.
So I turned in an incomplete assignment.
So, really, it was incomplete.
From the options, tap on "Incomplete."
words.defineEn: not having all the necessary parts
words.defineVi: không có tất cả các bộ phận cần thiết

examples: Try some dried apricots as a healthy snack.
For a healthier alternative, she replaced all-purpose flour with whole wheat flour in her muffin recipe.
I ate a delicious apple for a healthy snack.
He used rutabaga slices as a healthy alternative to tortillas.
He used swede slices as a healthier alternative to french fries.
words.defineEn: not having physical or mental problems
words.defineVi: không có vấn đề về thể chất hoặc tinh thần

examples: He saw that his unhealthy habits were influencing his children's behavior, as like breeds like.
Due to his sedentary lifestyle and unhealthy eating habits, John started experiencing middle-aged spread in his 40s, resulting in a noticeable increase in his waistline.
Ignoring warning signs of a heart attack and continuing to smoke and eat unhealthy foods is asking for a heart attack and can increase the likelihood of serious health problems.
Nina's modeling career pressured her to be as skinny as a rail, leading to unhealthy habits.
She is letting herself go by neglecting her exercise routine and indulging in unhealthy eating habits, which is affecting her overall well-being.
words.defineEn: not having a good physical or mental condition
words.defineVi: không có tình trạng thể chất hoặc tinh thần tốt

examples: Sultanas are a popular ingredient in fruitcakes and other baked goods.
Watermelon juice is a popular beverage during picnics and barbecues.
The mountain is a popular destination for climbers and hikers.
The passion fruit smoothie is a popular choice at the café.
The afternoon is a popular time for outdoor activities like picnics and sports.
words.defineEn: receiving a lot of love and attention from many people
words.defineVi: nhận được rất nhiều tình cảm và sự quan tâm của nhiều người

examples: Although many of his policies were unpopular, he had the courage of his own convictions to see them through.
And a tax hike in the near future would be very unpopular.
But it was deeply, deeply unpopular.
But in 1968, he was deeply unpopular.
Here's an unpopular opinion, but I like Dawn.
words.defineEn: not liked or approved of by a large number of people
words.defineVi: không thích hoặc được chấp thuận bởi một số lượng lớn người

examples: Keep your passport in a safe place.
After all, the highest branch is not the safest roost.
You can feel as safe as houses here with electric entrance gates.
Don't worry, Uncle Tim, your future is safe in our hands.
I always put my important documents in a safe deposit box at the bank because safe bind, safe find.
words.defineEn: being without danger or harm
words.defineVi: không có nguy hiểm hoặc tổn hại

examples: It's unsafe.
The city felt unsafe and on edge.
Don't be unsafe.
Yes, it's unsafe.
- I've never felt unsafe with firearms in this community.
words.defineEn: having a high degree of risk or danger
words.defineVi: có mức độ rủi ro hoặc nguy hiểm cao

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: healthy or in good health; recovered from illness
words.defineVi: khỏe mạnh hoặc sức khỏe tốt; khỏi bệnh

examples: Despite being unwell the previous day, Lily was up and about, ready to tackle her daily responsibilities with renewed energy and determination.
In February 2003, for instance, a Chinese doctor arrived at the Metropole Hotel in Hong Kong feeling unwell.
Is it possible for me to still beat my BDD and anorexia when I'm physically so unwell.'
Mrs Sparsit, who still seemed shaken and unwell after the robbery at the Bank, was invited by Mr Bounderby to stay at his house until she felt better.

Last evening I was very anxious for Mr. Harding another of the lawyers had been unwell several days and I was apprehensive he would not be in court, so the scientific part of the case, I had given no attention to, would also fall upon me.
words.defineEn: not feeling physically or mentally healthy or fit
words.defineVi: không cảm thấy khỏe mạnh về thể chất hoặc tinh thần hoặc phù hợp

examples: The book raises many important questions.
We mark important passages in a book with a pencil underline.
It's very important.
Important new laws are already in the pipeline.
Saving money for the future is really important.
words.defineEn: having a lot of value
words.defineVi: có nhiều giá trị

examples: I say, "Unimportant note."
Now you're excited about something very unimportant.'

This filtering mechanism is great for survival, as it allows your brain to safely disregard unimportant things, like what you had for breakfast two weeks ago, while paying special attention to what’s important, like that fact that there are ninjas behind you right now.
When I'm depressed, I see good things as fleeting, unimportant or stupid.
They made Yusuf feel very small and unimportant.
words.defineEn: not important; having no value
words.defineVi: không quan trọng; không có giá trị

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: The plot is almost impossible to follow.
In the end, she succeeded because nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
We can't say it's impossible until we've explored all avenues.
I find it impossible to get through to her.
Jannet has a mind like a sieve, so it's impossible for her to forget that.
words.defineEn: not able to be or happen; not possible to do
words.defineVi: không thể hoặc xảy ra; không thể làm

examples: She had no formal instruction in music.
Dinner was very formal, with everyone on their best behaviour.
He used to wear a silk tie with his formal suit.
He asked her wife to wear a formal dress to the event.
Emma is a casual dresser and would never be seen dead wearing formal attire or high heels.
words.defineEn: suitable for fancy, important, serious, or official occasions and situations
words.defineVi: thích hợp cho những dịp và tình huống ưa thích, quan trọng, nghiêm túc hoặc chính thức

examples: We are very informal around here.
You have some informal actors.
For this particular task, informal actors are much more efficient.
Better yet, it was also informal.
About 81 percent of India's workers ply their trades in the informal economy.
words.defineEn: suitable for friendly, relaxed, casual, or unofficial occasions and situations
words.defineVi: thích hợp cho những dịp và tình huống thân thiện, thoải mái, bình thường hoặc không chính thức

examples: The rich family owned a private jet.
The rich businessman owned multiple luxurious cars.
Mind your own business!
Water will always find its own level.
Many families own plots of land to grow food.
words.defineEn: used for showing that someone or something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị rằng ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó thuộc về hoặc được kết nối với một người hoặc vật cụ thể

examples: Other students followed her lead and boycotted lectures.
The lovers held each other close.
Other football stakeholders also got a share of the cake.
Join the other kids.
Share your thoughts with other people.
words.defineEn: being the one that is different, extra, or not included
words.defineVi: là cái khác, bổ sung hoặc không được bao gồm

examples: The two men reached the same conclusion.
The same thing happened to me.
All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
Anyone in her shoes would have done the same thing.
The two chefs are not in the same league.
words.defineEn: like another thing or person in every way
words.defineVi: thích một thứ khác hoặc một người theo mọi cách

examples: The old captain was dead as a dodo.
The owners were dead as mutton.
This fish is as dead as a herring.
Dead men can't talk.
But this bird was as dead as a dodo.
words.defineEn: not alive anymore
words.defineVi: không còn sống nữa

examples: Look alive!
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
Everyone would've ate him alive if he went for it and failed.
Look alive boys we got a lot to do.
Let us know you're alive
words.defineEn: not dead; living
words.defineVi: không chết; cuộc sống
